Back to the Drawing Board

Back to the Drawing Board is a 13 track album released in 2012. The official launch was in September 2012.

 

Rain

Vocals: Ciara McHugh
Backing Vocals: Cillian McHugh
Guitar: Cillian McHugh


The sky is grey, itâ€™s raining today
Pearls on the grass
Itâ€™s always the same, drops of rain
But the tears keep falling down

Tears in your eyes, misty skies
Vision is blurred
Where is the pain, you canâ€™t explain
Tears in the rain

Why do we cry?
Love or loss?

Drops on the glass trace a path
Of patterns and maps
Trickling down, from your frown
It tickles your cheek

Itâ€™s always the same, drops of rain
On the window pane
You wipe your eyes but continue to cry
And the rain falls

Stars

Vocals: Ciara McHugh, Cillian McHugh
Guitars: Cillian McHugh
Electric Piano: Donal McHugh
Drums: Donal McHugh
Bass: Cillian McHugh


I watch the sun go down:
Purple and red through the scattered clouds.
Golden light fills the sky.

Do you remember by the water?
Clouds in the way, sky was grey,
It didnâ€™t matter.

I watch the darkness fall and surround us all.
Warmth and light
Are faded and gone.

Cold bite on a lonely night.
Chill in the air as I sit and stare

Stare at the sky for hours trying to count the stars.
So far away, so long ago
Does it matter?

Standing alone, under the moonâ€™s glow
Empty night and the starlight.
Silver streak shines on your cheek as a star winks out.

Chasing Rainbows

the sun and the rain, the joy and the pain

and it carries you off
over the sky
washed up
left on the moon
broken hearts
chase rainbows

but bubbles burst or float away on a breeze

chase a rainbow

and it carries you off
over the sky

The Price Of Love

Acoustic Guitar: Cillian McHugh
Electric Guitar: Maurice McHugh
Piano: Donal McHugh
Drums: Donal McHugh
Bass: Cillian McHugh
Harmonica: Cillian McHugh


Waitingâ€¦ Holding out
Hoping time wonâ€™t run out
Torn between a rock and a hard place
Torn between love and happiness

Neither is enough, neither will suffice
Carry on the same - thatâ€™s the best advice
Hide from the shame, hide from your heart

Broken Words

Vocals: Ciara McHugh, Cillian McHugh
Guitars: Cillian McHugh
Drums: Donal McHugh
Bass: Cillian McHugh


You mean it. You say itâ€™s true.
I believe it. I feel it too.
You said to me, I said to you.

Words pick me up and carry me.
The thrill, the rush, the waves under me.
(Surfing the waves)

But waves break words are lost.
Crashing truths of changing tides,
Washed ashore and left behind.

Words are washed out ripples on the shore.
(Washed out waves)
Broken words canâ€™t carry me anymore.
(Broken, broken words)

You said it then.
Means nothing now.
Meaning lost.
(From your) Broken words.

Too Close

Vocals: Cillian McHugh
Guitars: Cillian McHugh
Piano: Donal McHugh
Drums: Donal McHugh
Bass: Cillian McHugh
Harmonica: Cillian McHugh


Listening to the silence of chords that were never played
Humming through the lines of mistakes we made
Listening while we wait is it too late

The final words he spoke still echoed in your mind
Oh as a song comes to a close for a second time
True for you now, wondering how

 

Sun

Vocals: Ciara McHugh
Backing Vocals: Cillian McHugh
Guitar: Cillian McHugh


Kids are playinâ€™ on the grass,
The sun is out, the rain has passed.
But the sun canâ€™t warm the void inside
When youâ€™re all alone.

Outside the window, bright and blue,
The empty sky is reflected through.
Through your eyes and into you,
Just the same.

The sun shines.
Burning inside.

A gentle breeze shakes the leaves
As it blows through the trees.
From deep inside you breathe a sigh,
Wondering why.

The sun is bright the sky is clear.
Youâ€™re all alone, thereâ€™s no one here.
Hurting inside you fight the tears,
And the sun shines.
